title: Initiative
excerpt: Determines the order of turns in combat. At the start of combat, everyone rolls initiative by making a Dexterity check.
markdown:
# Initiative

Initiative determines the order of turns during combat. When combat starts, every participant makes a [[dexterity]] check to determine their place in the initiative order.

## Rolling Initiative

### Dexterity Check
- Roll a d20 and add your Dexterity modifier
- You may add bonuses from features that affect initiative (like the Alert feat)

### Turn Order
- The game ranks the combatants from highest to lowest initiative
- This is the order in which they act during each round
- The initiative order remains the same from round to round

### Ties
If a tie occurs:
- The game decides the order among tied non-player creatures
- Players decide the order among their tied characters
- If there's a tie between a player and a creature, the game can decide or have them roll again

## Your Turn

On your turn, you can:
- Move a distance up to your speed
- Take one [[action]]
- Take one [[bonus_action]] (if you have one available)
- Interact with one object or feature of the environment for free
- Communicate briefly

You can also take a [[reaction]] on someone else's turn.

## Surprise

If you're surprised at the start of combat:
- You can't move or take an action on your first turn
- You can't take a reaction until your first turn ends
- Being surprised doesn't change your initiative

## Features Affecting Initiative

### Alert Feat
- +5 bonus to initiative rolls
- Can't be surprised while conscious

### Jack of All Trades (Bard)
- Add half proficiency bonus to initiative rolls

### Remarkable Athlete (Champion Fighter)
- Add half proficiency bonus to initiative rolls

### Feral Instinct (Barbarian)
- Advantage on initiative rolls
- Can act normally on the first turn even if surprised (by entering rage)

### Gloom Stalker (Ranger)
- +Wisdom modifier to initiative rolls
